title: 107_s1204
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2001" ensures Medicare coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for individuals who have received an organ transplant. The amendments made by this Act apply to drugs provided after its enactment date. The Act ensures Medicare coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for organ transplant recipients. The Act ensures continued Medicare coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for organ transplant recipients under specific sections of the Social Security Act. The Act ensures continued Medicare coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for organ transplant recipients under specific sections of the Social Security Act, with special rules applicable to individuals only eligible for coverage of such drugs. These rules include enrollment under Part D for drug coverage, responsibility for full premium payment, and subjecting drug provision to certain conditions. The Act guarantees Medicare coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for organ transplant recipients under specific sections of the Social Security Act. Coverage is subject to deductible and coinsurance, with inpatients entitled to drug coverage. The Secretary will establish procedures to identify and distinguish beneficiaries eligible for coverage. The Act extends Medicare coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for organ transplant recipients under the Social Security Act. The coverage includes inpatients and beneficiaries eligible for the complete benefits package. Additionally, a technical amendment is made to subsection (c) of section 226A. The Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2001 extends Medicare coverage for immunosuppressive drugs without time limitations. The amendments apply to drugs provided after the Act's enactment date. SEC. 4. PLANS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN COVERAGE OF IMMUNOSUPPRESSIVE DRUGS. This section amends the Public Health Service Act to include coverage of immunosuppressive drugs in certain health insurance plans. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2001 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs equal to pre-enactment levels. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the Public Health Service Act. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section regarding comprehensive immunosuppressive drug coverage for transplant patients. SEC. 714. COVERAGE OF IMMUNOSUPPRESSIVE DRUGS. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2001 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs that is as comprehensive as before the enactment date. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 are also made to reflect this requirement. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2001 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs, with amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 reflecting this requirement by inserting a new item after section 713. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2001 mandates group health plans to cover immunosuppressive drugs. This requirement is reflected in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with the addition of a new section, 9813. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2001 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs that is as comprehensive as before the enactment of the Act. This requirement is incorporated into section 9813 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, with amendments effective for plan years starting on or after January 1, 2002.
